alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Susquehanna; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 11:26PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Susquehanna, eastern Bradford and western Wyoming Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1125 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rome to Camptown to 7 miles south of Overton. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rush, Wysox, Montrose, Hallstead, Wilmot, Hollenback, Orwell, Mehoopany, Herrick and Great Bend. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
